meanings.definition: Unpleasant or offensive in taste or smell.
meanings.sent1: The food at the cafeteria got even nastier after it sat out all day.
meanings.sent2: The garbage in the bin started to smell nastier as the days went by.
meanings.sent3: The skunk's spray was even nastier than the cafeteria food!
meanings.sent4: The stench in the alley was so nasty, it seemed to get even nastier with each passing hour.
meanings.sent5: The spoiled milk left in the fridge for weeks was the nastier thing I had ever smelled.

meanings.sent1: Her nastier tone indicated she was not in a good mood.
meanings.sent2: The bully's words became nastier as he continued to taunt the other kids.
meanings.sent3: Despite his smile, his words held a nastier meaning underneath.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered overhead, casting a nastier shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The villain's laugh grew nastier as his evil plan unfolded.

meanings.definition: Characterized by spiteful or malicious behavior.
meanings.sent1: The gossiping group became even nastier when they heard the latest rumor.
meanings.sent2: The online comments turned nastier as the argument escalated.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful swat turned into a nastier scratch when annoyed.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley seemed to have a nastier vibe as the night grew later.
meanings.sent5: The witch's cackle grew nastier as she brewed her potion.
